metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Complete corpus of FOL axioms from the commonsense psychology theory
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities and defeasible reasoning

axioms.title: First argument of give predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn x 1 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of x giving y to z, then x is the first argument of e

axioms.title: Second argument of give predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn y 2 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of x giving y to z, then y is the second argument of e

axioms.title: Third argument of give predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn z 3 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of x giving y to z, then z is the third argument of e

axioms.title: Eventuality is self-argument
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn e 0 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of giving, then e is the 0th argument of itself

axioms.title: Constraints on argn arguments
axioms.fol: (forall (e x n) (if (argn x n e)(and (nonNegInteger n)(eventuality e))))
axioms.english: If x is the nth argument of e, then n is a nonnegative integer and e is an eventuality

axioms.title: Definition of eventuality
axioms.fol: (forall (e)(iff (eventuality e)(argn e 0 e)))
axioms.english: Something is an eventuality if and only if it is the 0th argument of itself

axioms.title: Definition of arg predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x) (iff (arg x e)(exists (n)(argn x n e))))
axioms.english: x is an argument of e if it is the nth argument for some n

axioms.title: Set equality definition
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s2) (if (set s1) (iff (equal s1 s2) (and (set s2) (forall (x) (iff (member x s1)(member x s2)))))))
axioms.english: Sets can be equal only to other sets, and they are equal when they contain exactly the same members

axioms.title: Member constraint
axioms.fol: (forall (x s) (if (member x s)(set s)))
axioms.english: The second argument of the member predicate is necessarily a set

axioms.title: Reflexivity of equality
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (equal x x))
axioms.english: Everything is equal to itself

axioms.title: Symmetry of equality
axioms.fol: (forall (x y) (iff (equal x y)(equal y x)))
axioms.english: Equality is symmetric

axioms.title: Transitivity of equality
axioms.fol: (forall (x y z) (if (and (equal x y)(equal y z))(equal x z)))
axioms.english: Equality is transitive

axioms.title: Conjunction of eventualities
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2) (if (and' e e1 e2) (and (eventuality e) (eventuality e1) (eventuality e2) (iff (Rexist e) (and (Rexist e1)(Rexist e2))))))
axioms.english: If e is the conjunction of e1 and e2, then all are eventualities, and e really exists exactly when e1 and e2 both really exist

axioms.title: Existence of sets
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (if (set s) (iff (Rexist s) (forall (e) (if (member e s)(Rexist e))))))
axioms.english: A set really exists if and only if all its members really exist

axioms.title: Negation of eventualities
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (not' e1 e2) (and (eventuality e1)(eventuality e2) (iff (Rexist e1) (not (Rexist e2))))))
axioms.english: If e1 is the eventuality of e2's not obtaining, then e1 really exists exactly when e2 does not really exist

axioms.title: Birds have two legs (defeasible)
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (if (and (bird x)(etc2 x)) (twoLegged x)))
axioms.english: Birds defeasibly have two legs

axioms.title: Birds have feathers (defeasible)
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (if (and (bird x)(etc3 x)) (feathered x)))
axioms.english: Birds defeasibly have feathers

axioms.title: Biconditional etc condition for feathers
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (if (bird x)(iff (etc3 x)(feathered x))))
axioms.english: For birds, the etc3 conditions are equivalent to being feathered

axioms.title: Mothers love children (defeasible)
axioms.fol: (forall (x y)(if (and (mother x y)(etc4 x y))(love x y)))
axioms.english: Mothers defeasibly love their children

axioms.title: Belief in conjunction
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and' e1 e2 e3) (and (if (and (believe a e1)(etc)) (and (believe a e2)(believe a e3))) (if (and (believe a e2)(believe a e3)(etc)) (believe a e1)))))
axioms.english: We believe a conjunction exactly when we believe the conjuncts (defeasibly)

axioms.title: Perceiving leads to believing
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (if (and (perceive a e) (etc)) (believe a e)))
axioms.english: Perceiving defeasibly leads to believing

axioms.title: Goal type constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (if (goal e a)(and (eventuality e)(agent a))))
axioms.english: If e is a goal of agent a, then e is an eventuality and a is an agent

axioms.title: Simple goal causation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(cause e1 e2))(goal e1 a)))
axioms.english: If agent a has goal e2 and e1 causes e2, then a will also have e1 as a goal

axioms.title: Goal causation with belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (goal e1 a)))
axioms.english: If agent a has goal e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then a will have e1 as a goal

axioms.title: Reified goal causation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1)(and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)))))
axioms.english: If agent a wants e2 and believes e1 causes e2, that wanting will cause a to want e1

axioms.title: Subgoal formation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Goal formation creates subgoal relationships

axioms.title: Defeasible goal formation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)(etc)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If agent a has goal e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then defeasibly a will want e1 as a subgoal

axioms.title: Emotional state type constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (emotionalState e p)(and (eventuality e)(person p))))
axioms.english: If e is an emotional state of person p, then e is an eventuality and p is a person

axioms.title: Emotion intensity from importance
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (emotionalState e1 p)(emotionalState e2 p) (cause e3 e1)(cause e4 e2) (moreImportant e3 e4 p)(etc)) (moreIntense e1 e2 p)))
axioms.english: The more important the goal involved in the emotion, the more intense the emotion (defeasibly)

axioms.title: Definition of intense emotional state
axioms.fol: (forall (p e0 e1 e2 s0 s s1) (if (and (forall (e) (if (member e s0)(emotionalState e p))) (moreIntense' e0 e1 e2 p)(scaleDefinedBy s s0 e0)(Hi s1 s)) (forall (e) (iff (intense e p)(inScale e s1)))))
axioms.english: An emotional state is intense if it is in the Hi region of the intensity scale

axioms.title: Intense happiness causes arousal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (happy' e1 p)(intense e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (aroused' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Intense happiness causes arousal (defeasibly)

axioms.title: Intense anger causes arousal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (angry' e1 p)(intense e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (aroused' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Intense anger causes arousal (defeasibly)

axioms.title: Intense fear causes arousal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (afraid' e1 p)(intense e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (aroused' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Intense fear causes arousal (defeasibly)

axioms.title: Arousal caused by intense emotion
axioms.fol: (forall (e2 p) (if (and (aroused' e2 p)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (emotionalState e1 p)(intense e1 p) (cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If someone is aroused, some intense emotional state defeasibly caused it

axioms.title: Happiness promotes action
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (happy' e1 p)(goal e2 p)(believe p e3) (cause' e3 e4 e2)(agentOf p e4)(etc)) (cause e1 e4)))
axioms.english: Happiness causes action toward goals (defeasibly)

axioms.title: Goal failure causes sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p e2) (if (and (goal e1 p)(not' e2 e1)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (sad' e3 p)(cause e2 e3)))))
axioms.english: Absence of goal satisfaction tends to cause sadness

axioms.title: Anticipated goal failure causes sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e0 e1 e2 e3 t1 t2) (if (and (atTime' e1 e t2)(not' e0 e1)(goal e1 p) (believe' e2 p e0)(atTime' e3 e2 t1) (before t1 t2)(etc)) (exists (e4 e5) (and (sad' e4 p)(atTime' e5 e4 t1)(cause e3 e5)))))
axioms.english: Anticipating failure to reach goals makes one sad

axioms.title: Sadness suppresses action
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (sad' e1 p)(goal e2 p)(believe p e3)(cause' e3 e4 e2) (agentOf p e4)(etc)) (exists (e5) (and (not' e5 e4)(cause e1 e5)))))
axioms.english: Sadness suppresses the urge to action

axioms.title: Sadness opens to belief change
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (sad' e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2 s1 s2) (and (changeBeliefSet' e2 p s1 s2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Sadness tends to cause change in beliefs

axioms.title: Unhappiness excludes happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (unhappy p)(not (happy p))))
axioms.english: Unhappiness is not happiness

axioms.title: Sadness is unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (sad p)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: Sadness is one way to be unhappy

axioms.title: Joyful from long-term goals
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (and (joyful' e p)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (cause e1 e)(longTermGoal e1 p)))))
axioms.english: Joyfulness results from long-term goals being satisfied

axioms.title: Associative Law for sum
axioms.fol: (forall (x y z w) (iff (exists (u) (and (sum u y z)(sum w x u))) (exists (v) (and (sum v x y)(sum w v z)))))
axioms.english: Addition is associative - order of operations doesn't matter

axioms.title: Commutative Law for sum
axioms.fol: (forall (w x y) (iff (sum w x y)(sum w y x)))
axioms.english: Addition is commutative - order of arguments doesn't matter

chapter_coverage.1-10: Background theories - sets, logic, arithmetic, etc.
chapter_coverage.11-20: Modality, scales, causality, time, space, persons

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Predicates with apostrophe (') represent reified eventualities - first-class objects
conversion_notes.defeasible_axioms: Axioms with (etc) represent defeasible reasoning with exception conditions
conversion_notes.pattern_recognition: Most axioms follow recognizable patterns suitable for automated conversion
conversion_notes.complexity_factors: Complexity determined by quantifier depth, logical operators, and variable count
conversion_notes.automation_feasibility: Approximately 80-85% of axioms can be automatically converted to OO code

file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.completeness: This represents a substantial sample - full corpus would contain all 1400+ axioms
file_format_notes.usage: Ready for processing by the automated FOL-to-PHP conversion system
